page.title: 17Transport in the Stone Area
page.content: The Potteries Motor Traction Company operates routes which pass through the area in and around Stone.There are bus services to the villages around Stone as well as to Stafford, Hanley, Longton, etc. Bassett's Coachways of Tittensor provide local bus services and provide school transport. The proximity of the A.34 trunk road and the M.6 motorway makes travel by car, lorry or coach to places farther afield an easy matter. There is a railway station in Stone.It is situated at a railway junction.The line from Stoke-on-Trent forks on its way to Birmingham via Stafford and London via Lichfield. The Trent & Mersey Canal passes through the Stone area making Stone a centre for holiday cruising.For further information about the canal see page 9.
